values: I don't know how many of you do the whole podcast thing and I don't care. That's a lie, I do care and I do know. But I don't know what podcasts you listen to and/or produce. And to that, I do not care. But tell me anyway. Because I do care. One of the ones which helps me get past Black Blog Blogitty Blog (AKA: The only show worse than cancer) is Fair Game. While, yes, the comedy writing is a bit heavy handed and Leno-esque at moments (it's true, Faith. Deal.), it sometimes has some brilliant shining moments of brilliancy. Such as this segment: THIS ONE. I'd give you a hint as to what it was in order to entice you to listen, but it is much better if you don't know. So just listen. What do you have to lose? Damn, this pledge drive has been wearing on me. I've decided to give to WNYC because they provide 90% of the podcasts I use to avoid Black Blog Blogitty Blog. I can't support my local station as long as they continue to broadcast the most racist, shallow and pointless show ever to take to the air during the exact moment in time that I want to listen to the radio. How bad is it? Remember when Juan Williams hosted Talk of the Nation? Those were the good times, my friends. This show has Juan as a senior news analyst. He does a superb job of taking a news story and adding nothing to it in any way. Unfortunately for Juan, I can read headlines on my own, so I still have no use for him. Oh, awful waste of time and money, if you didn't exist NPR may actually craft a good show that focuses on news from a minority perspective. Instead, we get Black Blog Blogitty Blog. The worst show ever.

A few of you may remem Well, one of you Ok, me. I remember. Hmph. I remember a few hundred years ago posting a link to an Amazon ad that used a not-thin guy to sell underwear. Remember now? He was kinda plump? Anything? No, well, anyway, I have found a female model who, while not not-thin, may be the perfect companion for that man. Meet the Razor Gator! Ah yes, the tool for people who, like me, don't like to change blades on their razors and, unlike me, are willing to try to sharpen their razors rather than, like me, run a dull razor over the same patch of irritated skin a billion times every morning (by which I mean, late afternoon). I love this model. Her eyes seem to scream "please don't hit me again." Her lips seem to say... wait, no lips. Or hips. Or knowledge that a camera is pointed at her. But wait, there's more! Don't let the section labeled "Razor Gator Research" pass you by. A section that uses technical terms like "Razor Gunk" might overwhelm some pedestrian visitors to the site, but not I. I soldier on! Like one of those people! The ones with the guns. Who have to keep going on? Lawyers? Marching on like a, um, band leader? I looked at the data that seems to indicate that use of the Razor Gator can reduce the chance of getting a bacterial infection. But I ask you this, imaginary opponent: Why would I want to sharpen something that, when able to directly enter my skin, can cause an infection? Could this be what is afflicting your model? And why does my keyboard not register every twentieth keystroke or so? Can you answer me that? And why is the Gator so damned manual? Is this not the near future as promised during my parents' childhoods? Maybe some sort of Razor Roomba that wanders the house looking for things to sharpen is in order. Maybe it can dance to a song by Spoon. Maybe it can check a twitter feed and remark to me, on occasion, how it, too, hates the entire notion of Twitter in a dry tone before commenting upon a story it heard on NPR earlier in the day. Because that, my dear Razor Gator, that would be sweet.

Been mostly offline for the last few days due to rain.  Stupid <s>swbell</s> <s>sbc</s> at&t.  Ooh, and now gunshots.  Love living in the ghetto (lite).

Note to self: remember for future consideration that braunschweiger plus jarlsberg equals many many poops.  Thank you.

I've been going back through my posts and adding tags. Good times. So far, THIS is as far back as I've managed to get. I still have a special place in my heart for the porn reviews, too. I should have kept those going. Edit: I hope I never wind up in THIS KID's car. That's some, um, interesting music he's been listening to. Granted, I remember when I bought my first CD player (a 6 CD changer! But a display model that was missing its remote and manual) and only had enough cash left over to buy one very cheap CD (Volume 2 of a rap compilation) with case damage...

Well, it sure is nice to have that whole Primary election thing behind us, right?  Now it's time for healing.  Bringing the party together under one glorious, unified, multi-racial banner for WhuhHUNH?! You mean it isn't over?  You can't actually mean that the advance data and polling, which strongly suggested that Clinton would not be KO'd in Texas or Ohio, was correct?  But all the news media kept saying that this was the last stand!  Like standing at that car rental place that tries harder!  And we all know how that turned out for Johnny Appleseed and his Band of Married Men!!  And the media kept quoting, in dire tones, that even Mr. Former President Clinton acknowledged that this was do or die WHICH ALWAYS MEANS DIE!!

Speaking of Die, including the 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 20-sided varieties, along with the "death" type of die, nearly ironically, as well.  J. Jonah Peterson, the co-inventor (but totally the one who came up with all the good stuff) of Mongols and Maps died at the tender age of 53+2d20 years.  He will be with us in our hearts forever, unless someone should raise him from the dead, in which case he will lose a level and, soon after, reach "venerable" age-- considering the stat loss would be a total of 6 to Str, Dex and Con, perhaps he should consider remaining in the grave and just rolling up a new character.

Speaking of segways, I love this:

<lj-embed id="5" />

Good Thursday to you all.

My apologies. Most sincerely. It's one of those things. You've transgressed (or, rather, I'VE transgressed) and you don't know how to go about sticking your head back out and apologizing and starting again without seeming like a liar and a person who is full of himself and without trying to be the abuser who says, "no, really, it won't ever happen again this time," and you want to mean it but you know you probably can't live up to it. You can't really go back to the way things were and real life will take hold and you'll have to do some laundry and before you know it you'll be mowing the lawn again. By which I mean I'll be mowing the lawn again. It's an electric mower I got from amazon. They should watch it with that free shipping crap. Anyway, wishing you were still in touch with your online friends. Wishing you knew where everyone was and what they were doing and not sure how to ask or if you even want to know. I mean, in my head Leo and Shauna moved to Cali and have become fabulously happy and successful and yet Lil' Mussolini is only 2 and is still irrepressibly adorable. Do I want to tamper with that? How could I? A few months back Whittlz messed with my image of her. She left NYC for Cali? Who would believe that? Who would believe that my Lizzie and I are still together and still super happy with each other. We own a home. I added my own beautiful kitten to her collection of two cats. My kitten's name is Boxcar Credenza. You know, Boxcar to recognize the hobo side, Credenza 'cause she's fancy like that. Who could believe that shit? I own a Zune. It's friggin' awesome! Who knew? I guess what finally brings me back. What has finally forced my hand. It's a job change. The place I've been at for 6 years is making me sick. I've fought the war for food quality and lost. Wednesday night we did a meatloaf special and I nearly cried. I came in an hour before the special was to kick off and everything was already cooked. The meatloaf looked like someone took a dump on a tray. It had been sitting off to the side for over an hour. Most certainly not food safe. The gravy was from a powder. The mashed potato was from a bag, and amazingly gluey. The green beans. My god. They were frozen, then boiled with bacon and ham. My parents are from the South. They don't quite get the difference between oil soluble and water soluble compounds, but they don't own a restaurant. I can understand their bad taste. I'm depressed with this shit. The owner thinks it is top notch. Yum! I can't even begin to express myself to her. Look, I know YOU like it, but this food is not worth eating. Says the employee to the boss. She loves it. Sycophants love it. Meanwhile... I might be buying a used book store. A profitable one at that. $50k for an easy million in inventory. The current owner didn't really want to be in the business. A stamp guy, to be honest. It's complicated. The store pulls in tons of profit (Half.com, amazon and eBay. Hooray technology!), but it is all a bit outside of my expertise. We'll see. I hope you have all been well. And I hope El' Duce hasn't aged. (PS. I can't believe the spell checker didn't find errors. I think tons of this crap looks misspelled. Including the word "misspelled.")

I haven't been here in a while. Or Pie. Or Threadless. Haven't even been checking the ol' email more than once a week and as for the social networking places, forget 'em. Girlfriend, man. Shit has been really really good. Couldn't be better, really. I basically live with her now. We're slowly emptying my apartment into her house as we wait for my lease to end. Planning a trip to meet her folks (she's met mine. Oh, the last of my grandparents died since I was last here, IIRC, and she met the whole family then. No "sorry to hear about"s, please.), also thinking about a trip to China. So, yeah, life has been good. I had a terrible case of bronchitis two months ago and haven't smoked since. I expected it to be harder to quit smoking, but it has been really easy for me. Maybe because I'm too stubborn to cave in to cravings. I'll have more time to spend here once I get caught up on episodes of the Wire. Until then, take this small piece of advice: If a small child asks if you are a specific character from a specific movie, say "no" unless you want to have to explain that you don't know where Buzz and Woody are every week for the rest of your life.

Bush has pissed off the most festive section of the Ridiculous Right with a friendly game of Who would win, Spiderman or Batman?. Yes, he decided what Cuban exiles should do should Castro die and have his government overthrown by the existing Cuban population. They should wait until the new Cuban democracy settles in before taking any action, of course. The exiles are not happy with Bush's imaginary potential future Cuban government's plans and have decided not to wait until this non-existent government settles in, declaring that they will seek to resolve their property rights claims with the as-yet-only-existing-on-bar-napkins government the instant it magically takes control of the current chock-full-of-Castro government. Democrats considered taking the entirely speculative position of supporting the exiles' dreamlike stance, but were afraid of having to actually back that position sometime in the vast and indeterminate future. Meanwhile, Ralph Nader has declared that he is working on a plan of action should Galactus attack.

Last night at Mangia there was an early-twenties guy with a mohawk wearing a Slayer t-shirt who got on stage during open mic to sing Elvis songs.  A Capella.  Did a pretty good job of it, too.  Yet another reason to move to the Lew.
I'd like to give a shoutout to Amazon, Hanes, the The Sportsman's Guide or whoever it was who decided to use a model with a body worse than mine. (click thumbnail for larger version)

Where were you born?: a minute outside of Chicago Have you kissed any of your MySpace friends? More than one, surprisingly How tall are you? 5'11" Where is your ideal house located?: In the year 2253 Last person you talked to?: Rider Have you ever taken pictures in a photoboth?: No. No I haven't When was the last time you were at Olive Garden? Well over a decade ago What are your keys on your key chain for? So they don't rattle around loose in my pockets, duh Where was the furthest place you traveled today?: Work, but not to work. Where is your current pain at?: Back Who do you want to marry?: Someone who wants to marry me, too Do you like mustard? Are Christians fooling themselves?! Do you prefer to sleep or eat?: Depends who what I'm eating. Who's your favorite person to drunk dial?: Steve Jobs. I yell, "You'll never get my money, biznatch!" Do you say the word 'biznatch?': never Do your parents slap you?: I would demolish them What is your curfew?: What the fuck is that?!?! How many rings till you answer the phone?: Caller ID takes one ring, but I'll usually let it go to voicemail because I hate you. Do you look like your mom or dad? Why not. Who was the last person who told you they hated you? Christ, so many people. Who was the latest? Superman? What color is your razor?: I swear to gawd, if you're talking about a cell phone I will take my shaving razor and jam it up your ass. How long does it take you in the shower?: Hmmm... cleaning myself, 10-15 minutes. Soiling myself, 30-45 minutes. Can you do the splits?: Why would I even try? What movie do you want to see right now?: Independance Day, but only that scene where the Whitehouse bites it. Over and over again. Yesss. Do you put lotion on your legs before you wear skirts or shorts? Lotion? Skirts? Shorts? Who the hell do you think I am?! What did you do for New Years?: Stayed at home with a big bag of ambivilance Did you think The Grudge was scary?: I am not 12 or under What was the cause of your last accident?: Spite Do you own a camera phone?: Sadly, yes. Yes I do. Would you ever dye your hair red?: In the blood of my mortal enemies? Perhaps. What song is overplayed?: Every song on the radio is overplayed. How many rings are on your fingers right now?: Well, there's... oh, wait... fingers? None. What are you drinking?: Luke warm Diet Coke. Jealous? Was your mom a cheerleader?: Was your mom passed around? Can you pump gas?: WHAT THE FUCK?! I'm not goddammed Miss Daisy! Who is your favorite person to talk to online? Fellow bitter old cranks and Canadians. What's the last letter of your middle name?: l Are you pregnant?: Yes. Yes I am. And she will bring the world to its knees. Do you still talk to your first boyfriend/girlfreind?: Hah, um, heh... first... (loading gun) Who did you vote for on American Idol?: (BLAM!) How many hours of sleep do you get a night?: between 2 and 7 Do you drink Egg Nog?: Not in July. Though, now that you mention it. Mmmmmm.... When was the last time you saw your boyfriend/girlfriend?: Please stop assumiong I've had one of these. Have you ever had a hickey?: I gave myself one when I was 7. It was magical. Do you stilll like the Dixie Chicks, despite the Bush Comments? I still don't like the Dixie Chicks, but now would consider sending them a few bucks because of the Bush comments, Republican. What do you buy at the movies?: A handjob and a round of felching. Do you know how to play poker?: Of course. Who do you cheat off of at school?: #1, not in school. #2, never needed to cheat, moron. Do you wear your seatbelt?: No, I prefer to get ticketed and risk a needless death at every turn rather than chafe my tits. What do you sleep in? A bed. Anything big ever happen in your town? Well, we're expecting a new telegraph line any day now. How many meals do you eat a day?: Meals? I eat no meals, only snacks and kittens Ever give anyone the Rejecton Hotline?: No, it is cowardly and cruel. (Call it yourself: 617-861-3962) Ever give anyone the Rejecton Hotline?: Indeed. Then she tried to act like it was a misunderstanding. Is your tongue pierced?: No way. Do you always read MySpace bulletins?: Never! Except for always. Do you have A.D.D?: My shoes are tight! Do you like funny or serious people better?: Silent people. I like people who are silent. Bring me mutes. Do you hate when ex's talk about their new girlfriends/ boyfriends?: Ex whats? Ex coworkers? Ever been to Vegas?: Hell yeah. Paris or Nicole?: Nicole is over-rated and has a lousy transit system. Do you make good pancakes?: indeed, but not in years. Is Nick Lachey hot?: Nick Who? Did you eat a cookie today?: Oddly enough, no. No I haven't. Not yet. Do you cuss words in other langauges? I never fuckin' pretend to not cuss by using silly tricks, punta. Do you steal or pay for your music downloads?: Both, but I prefer owning the physical CDs, so I do that the most, kid. Do you hate chocolate?: Do you hate America?! DO YOU?! What do you and your parents fight about the most?: I haven't fought with my parents in years and years. Favorite pro team?: AJ Styles and Christopher Daniels. Is your cell usually on viberate or ring?: Mine doesn't have "viberate"

Man, I'm so glad 6/6/06 is over. I was so sick of people going on about it being "the number of thar beast." I have to assume that they mean that it is the phone number of the beast from Beauty and the Beast. The cool one who lived in the sewer, not that fake-ass Disney shit. Also, I am really sick of having to point out this factoid*. Yep, the thing about how they've re-translated the earliest known copy of Revelations (or, rather, some of the texts that were later joined up in that oh-so-predictable final chapter of the Bible where we find out, gasp, the Satan did it!) and came to the solid conclusion that the number of the beast is, indeed, 616. That's right, an area code in Michigan. An area code in Michigan that does not touch Hell, Michigan. Haw haw, your god is an idiot. Not much of a concern, really, considering he isn't even real. Nor the devil. Nor any religous belief. Suck on that, Yoda. Of course, D&D is still cool. No, really, it's still cool... DAMN IT, IT'S COOL!!! And real! *Use of "factoid" should be taken with a grain of Lot's wife. Considering, yeah, it's concerning a text that has less reality in it than your typical episode of My Little Pony. Hey-oooo!

Hey, I got me one of them digital camera dealies and have been using it a bit. J showing off his new leg to me and K Regular customers K (different K) and C, looking at a group of civil war re-enactors in a production of Hamlet Testing out the zoom and lighting limits on regular H Regular K after a bit of playing around on Paint Shop Pro Owner M doing my dishes. Work faster, you lazy bitch!! Haw haw! Coworker S bagging croissants like a motherfuckin' pro Coworker S (different S) trying to look glamorous in her ridiculously large sunglasses Again. She really loves those glasses Went to a party Friday night, met the coolest dog. Star of the party She has the same name as my niece. But she kicks my niece's ass in ball fetching T, A and J-P. T and A are making their exit. Notice the sunlight lighting up that window? I left at 7 Longtime friend T is master of all that he surveys... on the table M was there. Yay, M. Semi-regular J evades the lens as she makes her monthly trip into town from Chicago to fulfill her legal obligation to the guard Part-time part-timer D hams it up rather than get back to work Co-founder and twin sister of owner M, K prepares to read the obits because she is really OLD. HAW HAW, old lady! Building maintenance guy R evades work while simultaneously pretending to be exhausted by work. Where's our new outlet, bitch?! Regulars B and P. I'm going to steal B's girlfriend away. Suck it, B, it's only a matter of time Coworker S models the new apron from Victoria's Secret VS, go back to the drawing board Owner's daughter and coworker R And again.

Let me speak as someone who is not the son of imigrants.  My people were called "colonists" and "indians" (or "forest niggers" or something).  What I need to say is this: This Bush imigration plan is fucked up. So, say you're Mexican, and the imigration policy isn't letting you in.  Your skills aren't what this country says it is looking for.  So you sneak in.  Now, under the Bush plan, all you have to do is pay a fine (okay), pay taxes (okay), prove that you've worked here a number of years (okay) and now you can get in line behind the other people who don't have the skills this country says it is looking for.  What?  Jump through hoops to wind up where you fucking started?!  That's craaaaazzzzz.... oh, wait, no... that's Bush.  

So let's back the fuck up.  All the way up.  All the way to my ancestors.  My folks (or, at least, most of my folks) came here as indentured servants.  Dig it?  Anybody see the connection?  They did manual labor for a few years to earn their place in society.  They worked to pay off their masters and that was that.  Here we are in 2006, long past the days of slavery, and we can't even live up to the barbaric practices of our ancestors?  Shame on us all.

It's been a long time since I've crafted a dead hooker joke.  Let's try this one:

How many dead hookers does it take to change a lightbulb?  I'm not sure, but I know that 14 haven't managed to do shit.

So, how many of you have been watching the Saddam trials? Anyone? Hello? Not me. They aren't broadcasting it here. Shouldn't we be demanding live in-court coverage? Shouldn't the government? Sure, it's an embarassing trial full of grandstanding, temper tantrums, Saddam in his PJs, etc etc. But, hey, wait-- This trial is what over two thousand US troops have died for! [cue flag raising in the background and national anthem] Thousands more troops injured, and tens of thousands of Iraqis killed because the US wanted Saddam out of power and nobody is fucking watching this thing? Not only should this trial be broadcast, but it should be broadcast on every fucking channel split screen with the faces of those who have died for this trial. It's an outrage, and we shouldn't stand for it.

Well, one way, maybe two.  So far.  And Haw Haw if you were thinking something sexual, you perv.

I've got SAD!  No, Leo, wait... it's not seasonal affectation disability.  Put down the rifle and back up.  It's Severe Anxiety Disorder aka Social Anxiety Disorder aka Social Phobia aka Loner Frightenillus aka Nuts.  I wasn't told if I want to kill my mother and sleep with my father or anything, but I was given three prescriptions, so I think that means that I win.  I mean, three drugs?  In your face, drugless losers.  You think you can take me on?  I've got three lines of scrawl here that says you don't stand a chance.

Anyway, the long and short of it is that I'm not just shy, I'm abnormally shy.  Shyness leads to depression which leads to fear which slides over to hate and buys it a drink and the next thing you know you're holding the limbo stick with the dark side.  So, one pill is for the shyness and depression.  It's only too bad that it is in short supply and the pharmacist told me that they hope they can get some in tomorrow.  One pill is so I can get my sleep thingy back in whatsis.  I've only been able to sleep for 4 hours at a time for the last week.  I keep waking up way too early, feeling fully refreshed for all of, say, 3 hours, then needing more sleep.  Pill number three is my emergency "the walls are closing in" pill.  I think it's cyanide.  Or LSD.  Not really sure, but I know that it will keep me from disclosing the location of the microfilm to the Ruskies.

So, tonight I'll be able to sleep.  Tomorrow maybe I'll be able to decrease my level of general craziness.  By Friday I should be back to building a satellite system that will redirect subs out of International waters.

My parents just emailed:

"Try to do it without meds." ... "it could be something like thyroid."

and to cheer me up about being girlfriendless my entire life...

"Your Grandpa C### didn't marry until he was 33"

Um, my grandfather committed suicide.  Nice example, pops.  My parents give the worst advice.  They've been happily married for over 40 years, which is great, but it leaves them with no way to understand the loneliness I feel.  I'll just stick to my plan, thank you.

Oh, and it took a bajillion calls but I've got some appointments for next week.  I'm oddly giddy about the prospect of being medicated.  I've always hated the idea of mood altering drugs.  Except beer, but only because it is delicious and made of magic.

And blind. So very very blind. No, my problems are still very real. But, hey, so there is this thing called a psychotologist or something-- which is a person who fixes brainurisms? Anyway, yeah, gonna go see one or more of them. And a doctor doctor. I'd thought of doing the psychologist thing earlier, but only long enough to go, "not for me." See, I've got some problems with the mental health field. I was raised in a family that is very rub-some-dirt-in-it-and-walk-it-off. Also, they believe in the power of prayer. Got a problem? Get over it or pray. While I've certainly dropped the latter, I still stick to the former like glue. Also, I like science. Ok, I love science. And while the mental health pharmaceutical industry is chock full of good hard science, the mental health professionals I'd be dealing with do not operate on it themselves. Finally, my brother gets therapy and whatnot and it is hard for me to do it and not feel like I'm infringing on his pain, somehow. You know my brother, right? He's the one who spent the first 3-4 months of his son's 6 month life trying to go through bootcamp on crutches (again and again). He's the one who got his wife a job with the same company he worked for, got a promotion and they extended it to her as well because of the relocation involved, they both relocated and then she left him 2 months later for their new best friend, who also works with him. Oh, and she dropped the bomb when my brother had just returned home from our grandmother's funeral. So, yeah, it's hard for me to go "Oh, I need a braintologist too!!" Because, even though we are very much strangers to each other these days, I really respect my brother and wouldn't want to do anything that would... I don't know. It's stupid, but I kinda feel like I'm an asshole for wanting a mindopractor as well, considering what he's been through. So, the move is off for one year, at least. It would be really really stupid for me to move while I have untreated mental problems. Damned dangerous, too. Now the problem is that I want New York. I want that baby bad. I got it so firmly set in my head that now I can't not go. So, I will take my first actual vacation in 15 years this summer and hell or high water, I'm going to New York City.

A badger in your pants, while extremely practical, does bring with it an enormous responsibility to not use it for personal gain. Most children would prefer that you not use the skull of Fred Rogers as a paper weight, candle holder or bookend. The jury is still out on doorstop. When deciding to spend a night flashing strangers on the street corner, take into account the weather forecast. It will be hard to get your message across if your message cannot be read due to shrinkage. While it may be fun to sit around with friends and work out in meticulous detail how many shooters were involved in Elvis's assassination, it should be noted that no bullet holes were actually found on his body-- so any type of ice bullet would have to reach solid state only once it was completely inside his body. This pretty much rules out your theory of invisible mag-men. Running just as fast as you can into the night will only grant you an increased heart rate, not, as you may have assumed, a large hairdo or the internal organs of your enemies delivered to you by ravens.

Ok, so tonight the coffeehouse did something it hasn't done in a decade because it ALWAYS SUCKS ASS. That's right, poetry slam. This lady who is raising money to go to Nationals (? National Spoken Word Bee?) got $50 plus tips to entertain a crowd that is so easily amused that they would certainly consider Dat Phan to be some sort of god who has taken mortal form. So I offer the following, and, please, add to it in the comments because I'm too tired to think up too many of these right now: POETRY SLAM DRINKING GAME 1. Use of phrase "nigger this, nigger that" 2. Use of "Wal*Mart" without rhyming anything with it 3. "Uncle Tom" reference 4. "Emperor has no clothes" reference 5. Use of "rape" more than three times without rhyming anything with it 6. A poem mentioning woman's inherent spiritual power and water or a body of water 7. "I have been to the mountaintop" usage 8. "I have a dream!" usage 9. Mention of three dead celebrities with strong political beliefs and not one of them is Lenny Bruce 10. Disparaging remark about bottled water while standing no more than three feet away from bottled water 11. Not rhyming "fast food life" with "fast poon wife" 12. Awkward use of onomatopoeia. 13. Mention of "Africa" as a mother figure without acknowledging that Africa is composed of cultures and/or geographical features that are vastly different from one another 14. Rhyming "mule" with "fool" 15. Impersonating Jim Morrison 16. Poem with the theme of numbers that add up to other numbers and the sum of the digits of those numbers add up to something that [SNOOOOOOORRRRRRRRE] 17. Poison is everywhere 18. Things built on the blood of other things without acknowledging that blood makes for a terrible substrate 19. Message of "guns are bad" 20. Mention of dancing with an object or force of nature 21. Poem about a traumatic experience or bad breakup that overuses the pronoun "you" rather than "Jim in maintenance", "Jill in accounts payable" or "I'm making all this shit up for sympathy" 22. Theme of "cameras are everywhere" 23. Use of "when x returns" where x is a religious figure, the pyramid builders or Santa but not "the Jedi" 24. Use of "white men in suits" and/or "white men in ties" more than three times 25. Yelling "fuck" without spinning under a spotlight with arms spread 26. Use of "cell phones" and "cell blocks" in same breath 27. Use of a long string of initials/abbreviations (CIA, MIA, 911, PCP, HIV, HMO...) 28. Reference to talking heads but not Talking Heads. 29. Mention of how many people do something/have something done to them in a specific and recurring period of time (eg "Every three seconds another child explodes while playing with a shop vac") 30. Theme of "oil industry is bad"

Will Save DC 25.

This is mainly a note for Leo (and Jeff, if Jeff is still out here.  Hi Jeff!  I don't have your post-domain surrender email addy).  The LJ community <lj user="ljrpg"> has kicked off a new campaign.  Of course, they picked a campaign that is doomed to completely fall apart.  That's right, the World's Largest Dungeon.  While rpgmp3.com has done very very well at sticking with this book, I doubt that this will go very far in the LJ universe.  "Thuggo, I'll bait it, you jump it from behind." "Sounds like a plan" (one week later) "Thuggo?"  "Thuggo deleted his account."  "Fuck!".  Rpgmp3 has the benefit of having a limited number of players, and all of them are people that have played together for quite a long time.  Also, the gm made the decision to not draw out every room, whereas the gm of ljrpg must type out the room description of every room, and track, what, 8 characters?  Craxy.  But I'd still like to play.

Also, I keep seeing ljrpg as lrpg, and it makes me laugh to consider people trying to lrpg via text.  "Lightning bolt! Lightning bolt! Lightning bolt!" "You only get one action this round!" "Round?  We have rounds?" "I jump over the table and drive my sword through the dragon's head." "Yes, we have rounds.  I don't know if you can do that, Ted."  "SIR DROMICULOUS!  And why couldn't I do that.  I can do it at home.  Pretend my couch is the dragons head.  Do you have my webcam feed?"

So, long story short, maybe this is part of the reason red states have higher abortion rates.

Short story long, I've been buying some pretty cool crap lately.  I guess I'm doing some mid-life-not-quite-a-crisis shopping, probably in the hope that I won't make it to 60, but then I look at the pretty cool crap and realize that my mlnqac shopping is pretty fucking nerdy.  I mean, come on Andy, I'm supposed to buy a sports car and develop a taste for hookers and blow, not buy the Sims 2 expansions, some computer upgrades and new tv antennas.  

Of course, now that I've got those expansions I can buy sports cars for all my Sims, which makes it a fact that tiny fake people who say, "Mischa Na," before peeing on the carpet are living it up better than I am.  The new antennas, fairly nice set-top bunny ears, means that I can watch more shows about hookers and blow without adjusting the old antennas, which were bunny ears without a stand so I had them dangling from a hook.  The new crap for the PC -- Now we're talking.  I've got a tv-tuner card so I can watch and tape shows about hookers and blow on my tv OR my computer.  It's practically like having a robot butler!  AND, since my old totally awesome video card gave up the ghost, I got a new more totally awesomer video card and a new power supply because the old one wasn't pushing enough power to handle the new card.  YEAH!  AND it is so totally shiny!  FUCKYEAH!

So, after a night of medium-style drinking, I decide to install all this shit (except for the expansions, yo, I been playin' dem fo WEEKS!) and a wireless card I had laying around.  You may be saying to yourself, that there sounds like an idear that is nothing but trouble.  Shut up, cowboy, I don't go to where you ride horses and slap the dick out of your mouth and then suck that dick and leave my wife hanging with nary a dick to suck, now, do I?  It all came together without a hitch.  I mean, of course there was the requisite MOTHERFUCKERs yelled when I kept dropping those tiny damned screws over and over and over and the more exasperated MOTHER FUCK ERs cried out as I searched the ground for said screws, but these things are <u>required</u>.  That's why <u>they direct you to do so in the manual</u>!  It's the ability to curse properly that separates the Professor Frinks from the Doctor Nicks of the world.

So, it's all running.  It's all wonderful.  The tv tuner card is so cool.  I had it autoscan for channels a la your typical VCR, and it did it lightning fast and found all kinds of channels I didn't really realize I could get.  2 of these channels are very religious in nature.  One of these religious channels drew me in with a children's show that was so unfuckinbelievably bad.  And this is the story of that show.

It's Barney, only the dinosaurs are green (and some pink and blue ones).  No, it is not live-action Dragon Tales, it's just ripping off dragon tales and throwing ILOVEJESUS in at odd moments.  Rather than a big cast of kids to sing and dance with the people dressed up as scientifically and anatomically incorrect dinosaurs (or Jesusaurs or something), they just have two big-eyed waspy girls and a series of cameos by super-square adults who pop in to move the plot forward and/or remind us of God's love.  

So, here is the story in today's show.  One of the wasps, we'll call her Jizzim, just found out that mom is knocked up.  Jizzim is feeling pretty low.  "I'm used to being the center of their love and now I won't be!"  So the dinos sing and dance for her (she immediately starts dancing with them, so it is debatable just how depressed she really was).  The song is, basically, "BABIES ARE GREAT!"  Yes, the dinos cheer Jizzim out of her there-is-a-baby-on-the-way-depression by telling her how great babies are.  The song wasn't religious in any way, so they used a crowbar to wedge Jesus into it.  At two different parts the tempo changes, the key changes, the dancing stops and they sing "AND JEEE EEEE SUS WILL SHOW THE WAAAAAY!" even though there was no context for it.  Really, it went, like, "Babies are great!  Babies are cute!  Babies are great!  Babies are fun!  AND JEEE EEEE SUS WILL SHOW THE WAAAAAY!"  SHOW THE WAY TOFUCKINGWHAT?!  Jesus will show us that babies are great?  Pardon me, but I don't think he spent much time telling us how to go about accepting how great babies are.  "Peter, you will deny me three times..." "I won't, my Lord!" "...but you can not deny how great babies are." "True that." "Double true."

So, bam, problem solved.  I'm sad about a baby coming.  Babies are great.  Wow, I'm not sad that a baby is coming anymore!  Then some stick-up-her-ass mother type drops by with a stroller full of 5-pound flour bags dressed up as babies and hands them out to everyone to take care of "because the flour weighs the same as a baby."  FEED YOUR FUCKING CHILDREN, LADY!!!  5 POUNDS!!!  CHRIST!  The lesson we learn from the flour experiment?  Even mildly retarded people in dinosaur costumes can take care of a baby.  And if you have a problem, just send out a little prayer to your old buddy Jesus.  My computer did not lock up at this point, but I sure did.

Happy Saturday everybody!

Ok, I'll give you birds, no need to argue it.  They have a 91% monogamy rate, and while I won't claim that this is a sign of them doing it, or even having the ability to do it, or that it exists in the first place, I will admit that this at least casts a fairly convincing image of them doing it and if I was to argue against this image it would be far too time consuming.  So I'll let you have birds, just know that I am still mocking you for it in my mind.  

Bees, most certainly, do not do it.  Insects simply do not do it.  Many bees do not even have sex at all and the queen, well, let's just say that the queen is a slut.  Hell, at birth the queen goes around killing her sisters before setting up for a life of screwing.  What does she think about her many lovers?  Well, they're her own children.  Her own children!  No, my friend, bees do not do it.  The sick bastards.

Fleas, no matter their level of education, do not do it.  They're insects.  Insects never do it.  Not even the ones who die due to having sex or die soon after.  Insects just lack emotion.  They are sociopaths.  Stop pretending that they can do it.

Yes, the Spaniards do it, and it isn't limited to the rich.  I mean, this is assuming anyone ever really does it.  Doing it may be a construct of the human imagination.  Do we have anything other than anecdotal evidence that it can be done?  But, if it can be done, the Spaniards can do it.  As can the Lithuanians.  But the Letts?  Who are you talking about here?  Letts is a common British surname, sure, but I don't think that it is proper to go throwing them in amongst the birds bees and fleas.  Yes, ok, the Dutch, the Finns and the Siamese do it too.  Ok, and Argentinians and people in Boston, too.  Christ.  Now, if you'll stop naming nationalities and get back to the premise of your argument.

Sponges?!  Are you out of your freaking mind?  First, there are no romantic sponges other than, say, the ones found in the bathtubs of people (or, say, the ones designed for insertion into people).  Those sponges are not alive!  Many of those sponges never were alive!  Sponges, alive or dead, do not do it.  They lack nerves, internal organs and muscles.  They don't even make contact with each other to reproduce sexually, and you think they do it?  You're clearly out of your mind.

Oysters do not do it.  You're being silly.  They don't make contact while reproducing.  They don't even get to know each other or their children.  They are loners who do not do it.  No, not clams, either, or jellyfish or electric eels or soles or goldfish.  You're just being childish.

So, I watched the first few episodes of this show back in the day, but was like, "Meh," because it failed to hold my attention, unlike my fat hard cock. I'd like to say it was the medication I was on* or the accent Hugh uses or the fact that I am totally retarded but, really, I have no excuse for not realizing that Hugh Laurie was, in fact, Hugh Laurie.  Maybe I should talk to a fake doctor about this.

Not one person has a single human line.  It's all, "Platitude," "Platitude," "Platitude?" "Platitude!" "Joint platitude."  Honestly, the dialogue is on par with your average AOL ad.  Spyware is bad.  How can I stop spyware?  AOL.  I will get AOL.  AOL is super nice.  Will it make me l33t?  D00d, yeah.  Nifty!  Also, I love that this hospital puts 7 doctors on every case.  Will I tape another episode?  Not likely.  Not unless I hear that the writers have been shot.  Out of cannons.  Into the writers of Gilmore Girls.

Ever consider pissing your pants just so you can feel a little warmth in your life?  I did consider it, but that's as far as it went.  Funny things go through your head when you've really got to pee.  Like, my favorite, is the fantasy of being pulled over by a cop and you jump out of the car with your hands up and yell "arrest me quick because I've gotta piss now!".  That one is great because, from there, you can play out all kinds of endings while you wait for the fucking light to turn green.  TURN GREEN!  TURN GREEN!  Please?

Anyway, Merry Holidays, everybody.

Now, this is where I'm supposed to go into some story about how Richard inspired me to win a marathon or cure cancer or save a burning kitten from a tree or something.  But I didn't do any of that stuff because of Richard.  No, I've just always been a Richard Pryor fan, ever since I was as tall as I was when I first saw Stir Crazy.  And can any of us forget his performance in Superman III?  I know I can't, and that isn't just because it was the movie my dad bought from the video store when it stopped renting Beta tapes and, therefore, was the only movie we could watch that we didn't tape the night before for over a decade.  No, no... wait, yes.  Yes, that's exactly why I'll never forget that movie and the way it predicted that we would soon have computers that could detect jars of acid and deduce the level of risk that acid posed for the computer itself.  Well, thanks for the memories and the laughs, Richard.  Here's hoping I can end this with a funny line that doesn't come off in any way as if it is mocking you.

So, after work tonight I decided to go out for a few drinks.  So, I'm plastered right now!  Or not.  Anyway, I'm doing my usual thing where I make eyes at some nice lady somewhere in the room and compose, in my head, a personals ad.  It would go along the lines of: SWM, 29, seeks woman who is smarter than him.  And then it would go on to identify my faults and strengths, focusing on my faults but with the occasional fault turned strength spin... like "brutally honest"... sure, you want that until I tell you that that dress does, in fact, make you look fat and I start in on how your best friend should be the first to die when the revolution comes.  Eventually, the girl I was making eyes at leaves and sometime after that I move to a table near a hot chick that I am now making eyes at.  But she's talking to this feller and she's bringing up security clearances and contracts and how she can help this guy in the job that he's in because she has contacts that can get shit done.  

So, now I'm not making eyes at her but rather, I'm making ears at her.  Turns out, she works for Senator Jim "FUCKING ASHCROFT JUNIOR" Talent.  That's right, Satan hisself (next to, say, Kit Bond and Dubya).  She informs the guy that Talent isn't what the guy thinks he is.  That Talent is a stand-up guy, true-blue, a real 'merican and whatnot.  Oh really?  Then she goes on to say that "Every Democrat out there was in favor of this war, and now they're using opposition for the war for political gain."  Hot or not, this chick just bought herself a reaming.  So, I lean over and tear into her about how only the Senate Dems voted for it, and not "all" of them and how the vote wasn't to go to war, but to give the President power to go to war with Iraq should he need it.  How it was a vote designed to give Bush's non-stop saber-rattling some authority so that war could actually be prevented and how Bush misused that authority to stage a "pre-emptive" war that did not pre-empt anything because nothing was being planned against us.  And and and, well, I guess I should tell you that I'm usually a very quiet person.  Extremely quite and shy.  But there is a certain point, after just the right number of beers, where the mind and the mouth act in such accord that I could possibly cripple you with it... well, let's just say, she was announcing what a great guy Jim "FUCKING ASHCROFT JUNIOR!!!" Talent is when I hit this point, and I didn't stop where I stopped above.  I didn't even stop within five minutes of where I stopped above.   By the end I was leaning over her, nose to nose and, using every expletive at my disposal*, told her where she could shove her Nazi-ass hero Jim "FUCKING ASHCROFT JUNIOR!!!!!" Talent and his mom and apple pie belief system.  She grabbed her purse and ran out the door.

On my way home, I couldn't stop giggling.  How should I allude to this penchant for rare unrestrainable ranting in the personal ad?  "May go nuts when confronted with the devil's agents"?  "Will make your homo-hating mom cry"?  "Prone to possession by Malcolm X's pissed off ghost"?

* Have you seen The Aristocrats?  Amatures.

Well, it's been a quiet day in Chanhassen.  It snowed.  The snow seems to go with the frigid weather.  Who'd have thunk it?  Went to the supermarket.  I'm a little disturbed by the fact that I can't seem to find any regional food.  Like, in Lewville we have so much regional food that it becomes a bit mock-worthy.  Yes, we fry ravioli.  Yes, we have a sandwich named after St. Paul that nobody in St. Paul has ever heard of or would ever eat, made of fried egg foo young.  Yes, we use parts of the pig best left on the pig.  Yes, we have brain sandwiches, slingers and square pizza that frightens non-natives.  But Chicago has its deep dish and hotdogs, New York has its cheesecake, grease pizza and dirty-water hotdogs, Philly has the Philly beef, Boston has beans, chowder and tea in the harbor, and California has Mexican food made by real illegals.  So, what about Minnesota?  Where is the moose pizza?  Where is the sweet and sour caribou?  Where are the... snow cones?  Not here.  And no, "hot dish" is not a regional thing.  There isn't a place in this country that doesn't have pot luck, the rest of the country just has better things to do than to celebrate it.

This town looks, from what I've seen, very new.  Like, suburb style newness.  I'm sure that there is a history to this town, somewhere, but it seems to have been replaced by strip malls, big box stores and billboards for crap that you can find in the absolutely horrifying Mall of America.  It's so new and clean that all regional food has been swept away in favor of Applebees and TGI Fridays, perhaps?  I don't know.  All I know is that I want to eat some moose and caribou and otter and rhino and whatever else they can grab, roast and throw onto a plate and I can't find any.  

Also, I can't quite understand how the Twin Cities managed to get so big.  What is it that draws people to this wasteland.  How can it bring in so much corporate cash?  It sits out here in the middle of nowhere, up near Canada's middle of nowhere, freezing cold and succeeding nicely.  How can this town be doing so well while St. Louis sits in the shitter?  My theory?  I'm gonna say liberal white flight-- white folks didn't want to look like racists when they decided to move out of the real urban cities, so they built themselves a little honky fake-urban mecca up here where black folks are too smart to come.  I say "fake-urban" because every street feels like it's in a suburb.  In fact, it's all very Chicago-suburb.  So suburban, in fact, that we drove through both of the twin cities to the suburbs without noticing a difference at all.  What's up with that?

Gotta go get some beer in me.  Where the women are strong, the women are hot and the children are forgotten.  I hope.

So, this new King Kong movie... not to be a negative nelson, but I'm pretty sure that if I go off to a distant land and find dinosaurs and Kong, ima gonna try to bring one of dem dinos back.  Sure, it wouldn't make for that great of a remake of Kong, y'know, leaving him in the middle of nowhere without any clothes, dames, buildings, Italian plumbers or planes, and the dino would just eat the romantic lead, but still!  IT'S A LIVING DINOSAUR!!!  Sorry Kong.

So, here I am, writing from the confines of Minneapolis/St. Paul Corporo-poofter Inn.  My parents thought it would be a good idea to put me up here.  The place kinda has a warmed over Martha Stewart feel.  All of the rooms are named after towns.  Mine is called Deadwood, go figure.  Now, normally I'd be thrilled to be staying in the Deadwood suite, right?  But, get this, the Deadwood suite is nonsmoking.  Also, the bar is closed tonight and I can't find a whore or a game of Faro anywhere.  I'm going to have to call shenanigans.  Shenanigans!

Also, as one may expect from a place this close to Canada, it is cold here.  Which makes me wonder why I didn't bring a heavy coat.  Or any coat.  Or a jacket.  I've got a hoodie.  Granted, it is a Transom.org hoodie which, just last night, did not rip when I tripped up my own damn front steps -- something that can not be said for the jeans I was wearing, or the skin under those jeans, or the skin under the hoodie.  So, it would be reasonable to assume that this hoodie has some sort of public radio based super powers.  I mean, that's what I assumed, anyway.  Even though, as of yet, it has only demonstrated its abilities to be quite free and to avoid sustaining damage, while passing that damage along to its wearer.  Which would put it on the same level as, say, Henry Pym and Jubilee.

On the bright side, I did discover that my parents have found a new way to destroy turkey.  Usually, it's the old 6-8 hour baking followed by the now-dry meat being ripped from the carcass by hand.  This time the turkey was over-cooked the day before, refrigerated, sliced and re-heated.

So, I'm thankful for my new laptop, wireless access and ventilation fans in hotel bathrooms.  Smokefree Deadwood, my ass.

Hello, my beloved.  Today, while you were out waxing the Maserati with Fernando from the tennis club, I took it upon myself to run out and buy a shiny new copper Toshiba notebook computer.  It has a beautiful  17" widescreen with TruBrite<sup>TM</sup> technology, which allows me to keep more amature webcam feeds open than ever before.  The built-in wireless comes in handy, as well.  Why, right now I'm sitting in my regular booth at Lady Mama Dawn's Books and Peepshow-a-rita while illegally downloading the entire collected works of William Shakespeare.  But, I'm thinking of you, and that is what is really important, isn't it.  I'm thinking of you and Fernando and how you will refill the tank in the Maserati now that I've emptied the bank accounts, liquidated our assets, cancelled all the credit cards and have bought my ticket to a destination that believes that "alimony" means something about stoning your ex-wife.  Lovely people, I'm told.  Anyway, ta-ta, beyotch.

OH NO! Somehow I have gotten, like, 4 little cuts on the inside of my lip over the past hour or so and I have no idea how. I mean, other than my one fang maybe gouging lines in it... there is that. But still. Stingy. Mysterious stingy. Which would be a great band name.

8: At the pub.  Somebody is setting up chairs as Jed wakes up on the sidewalk outside by the window.  Jed walks away.  Jed walks along the rocky coastline.  He goes into Rhonda's house and finds that Rhonda and all of her stuff is gone.  On the bedframe rests the hoe and a blood-stained sheet.  Jed cradles the sheet and cries.
